TEXT: A list of the applicants is set out in the appendix . They were represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

The applicants are all active members of various law - enforcement agencies . Under the rules which were in force when the applicants took up duties , they were entitled to retire after DATE of service , irrespective of their age , or at DATE than the generally valid age - limit for old - age pension . These advantages were available in the form of a ‘ service pension’ ( szolgálati nyugdíj ) .

As of DATE , the service pension as such was abolished by a legislative amendment ( Act no . ORG of DATE ) . In its stead , a so - called service allowance ( szolgálati járandóság ) was instituted , with different amounts and conditions . In particular , the DATE age benefit is no longer applicable in cases like that of the applicants , and moreover , no special pension or allowance is available merely as a consequence of a CARDINAL-year long service . Furthermore , a CARDINAL - time benefit of CARDINAL months’ salary due on retirement was also removed . In other words , under the new scheme the applicants’ pension entitlement has become largely identical to that of the general population , despite the expectations they had when entering the service .
